title: Authors and Citation
text: Gao T, Biederstedt E, Kharchenko P, Wu Y (2023). scistreer: Maximum-Likelihood Perfect Phylogeny Inference Scale. https://github.com/kharchenkolab/scistreer, https://kharchenkolab.github.io/scistreer/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {scistreer: Maximum-Likelihood Perfect Phylogeny Inference at Scale},   author = {Teng Gao and Evan Biederstedt and Peter Kharchenko and Yufeng Wu},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/kharchenkolab/scistreer, https://kharchenkolab.github.io/scistreer/}, }

what: Maximum-Likelihood Perfect Phylogeny Inference at Scale
title: Maximum-Likelihood Perfect Phylogeny Inference at Scale
text: Fast maximum-likelihood phylogeny inference noisy single-cell data using ‘ScisTree’ algorithm (Wu, Bioinformatics 2019). ‘scistreer’ provides ‘R’ interface improves speed via ‘Rcpp’ ‘RcppParallel’, making method applicable massive single-cell datasets (>10,000 cells).

title: Maximum-Likelihood Perfect Phylogeny Inference at Scale
text: install stable CRAN version, get recent updates, can install github version via devtools:

title: Maximum-Likelihood Perfect Phylogeny Inference at Scale
text: Within R, need supply genotype probability matrix (cell x mutation), entry probability cell harbors mutation. example, output maximum likelihood tree ape::phylo object. can visualize output probability matrix follows:
code: treeML = run_scistree(P_example, ncores = 8, init = 'UPGMA', verbose = FALSE) plot_phylo_heatmap(treeML, P_example)

title: Maximum-Likelihood Perfect Phylogeny Inference at Scale
text: scistreer 10x faster original implementation single thread. runtime scistreer can reduced shared-memory multi-threading via RcppParallel.

title: Maximum-Likelihood Perfect Phylogeny Inference at Scale
text: original publication, please refer : Yufeng Wu, Accurate efficient cell lineage tree inference noisy single cell data: maximum likelihood perfect phylogeny approach, Bioinformatics, Volume 36, Issue 3, 1 February 2020, Pages 742–750, https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btz676 like cite package, please use: Teng Gao, Evan Biederstedt, Peter Kharchenko, Yufeng Wu (2022). ScisTreeR: Speeding ScisTree Algorithm via RcppParallel. R package version 1.0.0. https://github.com/kharchenkolab/scistreer
